pppBridgeTable.name: pppBridgeTable
pppBridgeTable.description: Table containing the parameters and statistics for the local PPP entity that are related to the operation of Bridging over the PPP.

pppBridgeEntry.name: pppBridgeEntry
pppBridgeEntry.description: Bridging information for a particular PPP link.

pppBridgeOperStatus.name: pppBridgeOperStatus
pppBridgeOperStatus.description: The operational status of the Bridge network protocol. If the value of this object is up then the finite state machine for the Bridge network protocol has reached the Opened state.

pppBridgeLocalToRemoteTinygramCompressio.name: pppBridgeLocalToRemoteTinygramCompression
pppBridgeLocalToRemoteTinygramCompressio.reference: Section 6.7, Tinygram Compression Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeLocalToRemoteTinygramCompressio.description: Indicates whether the local node will perform Tinygram Compression when sending packets to the remote entity. If false then the local entity will not perform Tinygram Compression. If true then the local entity will perform Tinygram Compression. The value of this object is meaningful only when the link has reached the open state (pppBridgeOperStatus is opened).

pppBridgeRemoteToLocalTinygramCompressio.name: pppBridgeRemoteToLocalTinygramCompression
pppBridgeRemoteToLocalTinygramCompressio.reference: Section 6.7, Tinygram Compression Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeRemoteToLocalTinygramCompressio.description: If false(1) then the remote entity is not expected to perform Tinygram Compression. If true then the remote entity is expected to perform Tinygram Compression. The value of this object is meaningful only when the link has reached the open state (pppBridgeOperStatus is opened).

pppBridgeLocalToRemoteLanId.name: pppBridgeLocalToRemoteLanId
pppBridgeLocalToRemoteLanId.reference: Section 6.8, LAN Identification Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeLocalToRemoteLanId.description: Indicates whether the local node will include the LAN Identification field in transmitted packets or not. If false(1) then the local node will not transmit this field, true(2) means that the field will be transmitted. The value of this object is meaningful only when the link has reached the open state (pppBridgeOperStatus is opened).

pppBridgeRemoteToLocalLanId.name: pppBridgeRemoteToLocalLanId
pppBridgeRemoteToLocalLanId.reference: Section 6.8, LAN Identification Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeRemoteToLocalLanId.description: Indicates whether the remote node has indicated that it will include the LAN Identification field in transmitted packets or not. If false(1) then the field will not be transmitted, if true(2) then the field will be transmitted. The value of this object is meaningful only when the link has reached the open state (pppBridgeOperStatus is opened).

pppBridgeConfigTable.name: pppBridgeConfigTable
pppBridgeConfigTable.description: Table containing the parameters and statistics for the local PPP entity that are related to the operation of Bridging over the PPP.

pppBridgeConfigEntry.name: pppBridgeConfigEntry
pppBridgeConfigEntry.description: Bridging Configuration information for a particular PPP link.

pppBridgeConfigAdminStatus.name: pppBridgeConfigAdminStatus
pppBridgeConfigAdminStatus.description: The immediate desired status of the Bridging network protocol. Setting this object to open will inject an administrative open event into the Bridging network protocol's finite state machine. Setting this object to close will inject an administrative close event into the Bridging network protocol's finite state machine.

pppBridgeConfigTinygram.name: pppBridgeConfigTinygram
pppBridgeConfigTinygram.reference: Section 6.7, Tinygram Compression Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeConfigTinygram.description: If false then the local BNCP entity will not initiate the Tinygram Compression Option Negotiation. If true then the local BNCP entity will initiate negotiation of this option.

pppBridgeConfigRingId.name: pppBridgeConfigRingId
pppBridgeConfigRingId.reference: Section 6.4, IEEE 802.5 Remote Ring Identification Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeConfigRingId.description: If false then the local PPP Entity will not initiate a Remote Ring Identification Option negotiation. If true then the local PPP entity will intiate this negotiation. This MIB object is relevant only if the interface is for 802.5 Token Ring bridging.

pppBridgeConfigLineId.name: pppBridgeConfigLineId
pppBridgeConfigLineId.reference: Section 6.5, IEEE 802.5 Line Identification Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeConfigLineId.description: If false then the local PPP Entity is not to initiate a Line Identification Option negotiation. If true then the local PPP entity will intiate this negotiation. This MIB object is relevant only if the interface is for 802.5 Token Ring bridging.

pppBridgeConfigLanId.name: pppBridgeConfigLanId
pppBridgeConfigLanId.reference: Section 6.8, LAN Identification Option, of RFC1220
pppBridgeConfigLanId.description: If false then the local BNCP entity will not initiate the LAN Identification Option Negotiation. If true then the local BNCP entity will initiate negotiation of this option.

pppBridgeMediaTable.name: pppBridgeMediaTable
pppBridgeMediaTable.description: Table identifying which MAC media types are enabled for the Bridging NCPs.

pppBridgeMediaEntry.name: pppBridgeMediaEntry
pppBridgeMediaEntry.description: Status of a specific MAC Type for a specific PPP Link.

pppBridgeMediaMacType.name: pppBridgeMediaMacType
pppBridgeMediaMacType.reference: Section 6.6, MAC Type Support Selection, of RFC1212.
pppBridgeMediaMacType.description: The MAC type for which this entry in the pppBridgeMediaTable is providing status information. Valid values for this object are defined in Section 6.6 MAC Type Support Selection of RFC1220 (Bridging Point-to-Point Protocol).

pppBridgeMediaLocalStatus.name: pppBridgeMediaLocalStatus
pppBridgeMediaLocalStatus.reference: Section 6.6, MAC Type Support Selection, of RFC1212.
pppBridgeMediaLocalStatus.description: Indicates whether the local PPP Bridging Entity will accept packets of the protocol type identified in pppBridgeMediaMacType on the PPP link identified by ifIndex or not. If this object is accept then any packets of the indicated MAC type will be received and properly processed. If this object is dont- accept then received packets of the indicated MAC type will not be properly processed.

pppBridgeMediaRemoteStatus.name: pppBridgeMediaRemoteStatus
pppBridgeMediaRemoteStatus.reference: Section 6.6, MAC Type Support Selection, of RFC1212.
pppBridgeMediaRemoteStatus.description: Indicates whether the local PPP Bridging Entity believes that the remote PPP Bridging Entity will accept packets of the protocol type identified in pppBridgeMediaMacType on the PPP link identified by ifIndex or not.

pppBridgeMediaConfigTable.name: pppBridgeMediaConfigTable
pppBridgeMediaConfigTable.description: Table identifying which MAC media types are enabled for the Bridging NCPs.

pppBridgeMediaConfigEntry.name: pppBridgeMediaConfigEntry
pppBridgeMediaConfigEntry.description: Status of a specific MAC Type for a specific PPP Link.

pppBridgeMediaConfigMacType.name: pppBridgeMediaConfigMacType
pppBridgeMediaConfigMacType.reference: Section 6.6, MAC Type Support Selection, of RFC1212.
pppBridgeMediaConfigMacType.description: The MAC type for which this entry in the pppBridgeMediaConfigTable is providing status information. Valid values for this object are defined in Section 6.6 MAC Type Support Selection of RFC1220 (Bridging Point-to-Point Protocol).

pppBridgeMediaConfigLocalStatus.name: pppBridgeMediaConfigLocalStatus
pppBridgeMediaConfigLocalStatus.reference: Section 6.6, MAC Type Support Selection, of RFC1212.
pppBridgeMediaConfigLocalStatus.description: Indicates whether the local PPP Bridging Entity should accept packets of the protocol type identified in pppBridgeMediaConfigMacType on the PPP link identified by ifIndex or not. Setting this object to the value dont-accept has the affect of invalidating the corresponding entry in the pppBridgeMediaConfigTable object. It is an implementation-specific matter as to whether the agent removes an invalidated entry from the table. Accordingly, management stations must be prepared to receive tabular information from agents that corresponds to entries not currently in use. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.
